subject: Gardening
title: Negative Space: The Power of Empty
description: A 60-second lesson on Negative Space: The Power of Empty.

hook.text: A lawn isn't wasted space. It's negative spaceâ€”the visual breathing room that makes everything around it shine.

buildup.text: Negative space in design is empty area that defines and highlights the positive elements surrounding it.

discovery.text: Japanese Zen gardens use vast gravel expanses to frame a single rock. The emptiness is the design, not the rock.

twist.text: New gardeners fill every inch with plants. Expert designers know that restraintâ€”leaving space open.

climax.text: The most powerful design tool isn't what you add. It's what you leave out.

punchline.text: Empty space isn't wasted. It's the design's backbone.

quiz.question: What role does negative space play in garden design?
options: It provides areas for future planting as the garden matures
It creates visual breathing room that highlights surrounding elements
It reduces maintenance by limiting planted area
